unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbusters: Why You Need to Hit Up a Film Festival!
normalised: Beyond the Blockbusters: Why You Need to Hit Up a Film Festival!

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Tired of the same old masala movies playing on loop at your local theatres? Then listen up, because I'm about to let you in on a seriously cool secret: film festivals!
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Tired of the same old masala movies playing on loop at your local theatres? Then listen up, because I am about to let you in on a seriously cool secret: film festivals!

unnormalised: Think of them as a giant celebration of all things cinema, a place where you can discover hidden gems, indie flicks, and documentaries that’ll blow your mind – all without having to wait for Netflix to (maybe) pick them up. Forget the same old item numbers, film festivals offer stories that really connect with you, ya know?

unnormalised: Now, I know what you're thinking: "Film festivals? Sounds fancy and expensive!" Well, some *are*, sure. But many smaller, regional ones are super accessible, and honestly, the experience is worth its weight in gold (or maybe even Rs. 10,000 depending on the festival!).
normalised: Now, I know what you are thinking: "Film festivals? Sounds fancy and expensive!" Well, some *are*, sure. But many smaller, regional ones are super accessible, and honestly, the experience is worth its weight in gold (or maybe even rupees ten thousand depending on the festival!).

unnormalised: Imagine this: You're chilling in Goa at IFFI (International Film Festival of India), surrounded by palm trees and the smell of delicious seafood, after watching a thought-provoking film by a new director from Kerala. Or maybe you’re in Kolkata, browsing the vibrant street food stalls after catching a Satyajit Ray retrospective screening. Talk about a cinematic experience!

Or maybe you are in Kolkata, browsing the vibrant street food stalls after catching a Satyajit Ray retrospective screening. Talk about a cinematic experience!

unnormalised: It's not just about the films, either. You get to meet other film lovers, chat with directors and actors (sometimes even *actual* Bollywood stars!), and maybe even network if you’re aspiring to break into the industry. Who knows, you might even land that dream job in film production after striking up a conversation with someone at the after-party!

unnormalised: And hey, if nothing else, you'll have some seriously cool stories to tell at your next chai session with friends. Think about it: you could be the one introducing them to their next favorite filmmaker! So ditch the predictable weekend movie plan and check out a film festival near you. You might just discover your new passion. There are several happening every year, even in smaller cities within a radius of 500 km of Mumbai. What are you waiting for? Get searching and grab those tickets before they are all sold out! You won't regret it, promise!
